Sequence Information.Peptide Name: GLK-19 (Lys-rich; Leu-rich; synthetic AMPs20; UCLL1; Derivatives: GLR-19, ZZH)
Sequence Information.Source: database-aided de novo designed using freqently occurring amino acids, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: This peptide was de novo designed based on the frequently occurring amino acid residues (Gly, Lue, and Lys) found in a defined group of AMPs such as those from amphibians (see the reference). It displayed anti-E. coli activity similar to human LL-37. Based on the knowledge derived from this database, conversion of all lysines to arginines conferred HIV inhibitory activity to the mutant peptide GLR-19 (Wang G et al. 2010 Antimicrob. Agents Chemother 54: 1343-1346). Replaced 7/2010.
Literature Information.Author: Wang G, Li X, Wang Z.
Literature Information.Title: APD2: the updated antimicrobial peptide database and its application in peptide design
